original: In animals that have lost all sensory input to a moving limb, certain gait variables—such as center of mass acceleration, velocity, and position—remain consistent across different groups. During postural control, delayed feedback mechanisms play a crucial role in the temporal reproduction of task-level functions, including walking. The nervous system integrates feedback from center of mass acceleration, velocity, and position to predict
sampled: In animals that have lost all sensory input to a moving limb, certain gait variables—such like center of mass acceleration, velocity, and position—remain consistent across different groups. During postural control, delayed feedback mechanisms play a crucial part in the temporal reproduction of task-level functions, including walking. The nervous system integrates feedback from center of load acceleration, velocity, plus position to predict
